response:
The combination of optic neuritis and myelopathy (cervical cord signs) suggests an inflammatory demyelinating condition. While Multiple Sclerosis is common in this demographic, the presence of asymptomatic pulmonary airspace disease (with normal inflammatory markers) makes Neurosarcoidosis a strong differential. NMOSD and MOGAD are critical considerations for longitudinally extensive cord lesions or recurrent optic neuritis.
